info.description:
A collection with resources that define operations to create, update and view and delete Multi-Instance Custom Object Data. Custom objects accessible through the Workday REST API are extensions of existing Workday objects. Example: Worker object can be extended to include a custom object named Stock Grants. If a single worker can have more than 1 stock grant, it is an example of a multi-instance custom object.
To view information about custom objects, use the Custom Object Definitions resource.

Since field types vary based on the custom object field definitions, the recommendation is to do a GET request of an instance created in the UI first to understand the format that the body of update requests should take.
info.title: Custom Object Data v2 (Multi-Instance)

tags.name: Custom Objects
tags.description: Create, update, and delete for a multi-instance custom object

parameters.name: extendedBusinessObjectResource
parameters.description: Business Object that has been extended by the multi-instance custom object

parameters.name: extendedBusinessObjectId
parameters.description: ID of the instance of the Extended Business Object

parameters.name: customObjectAlias
parameters.description: Web service alias for the custom object definition. When the custom object is created, the alias is supplied by the object creator.

get.summary: Get a collection of multi-instance custom objects
get.description:
Returns an array of the multi-instance custom objects for a specific instance of an extended business object.
Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

parameters.name: customObjectAlias
parameters.description: Web service alias for the custom object. When the custom object is created, the alias is supplied by the object creator.

post.summary: Create new custom objects or update existing instances of multi-instance custom objects.
post.description:
To POST custom objects, in the request body you supply at minimum the specific extended Workday object, a value for the reference ID, and any required custom fields defined for the custom object. Also include in the request body any additional custom fields and their values. A successful POST request that creates an object returns the HTTP status code: 201 Created.
Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

parameters.name: updateIfExists
parameters.description: When true, updates the object if it exists. When false, return an error if the object exists. Default is false. If the object does not exist, a new object is created regardless of this setting.

parameters.name: bulk
parameters.description: When true, this allows for an array of custom objects to be provided in the request body. This allows for multiple custom objects to be created and/or updated simulatneously. Default is false.

parameters.name: putCustomObjectRequest
parameters.description: The details of the custom object that's being persisted

parameters.name: customObjectAlias
parameters.description: Web service alias for the custom object. When the custom object is created, the alias is supplied by the object creator.

parameters.name: customObjectID
parameters.description: For multi-instance custom objects, the custom object ID is any valid ID for the custom object which includes the compound ID for the custom object. The compound ID is defined as a concatenation of the WID of the extended business object, a semi-colon, and the reference ID of the custom object. Example: The Worker ID (ID=66faa65677834f0a9b586dd5645e900) links with the reference ID (grantName=Merit_4Q2011), separated by a semicolon (;) to look like: /customObjects/stockGrants/66faa65677834f0a9b586dd5645e9004;grantName=Merit_4Q2011

get.summary: Get a specific instance of a multi-instance custom object
get.description:
To GET a specific instance of a multi-instance custom object the custom object ID must be provided; the custom object ID is any valid ID for the custom object, OR the compound ID.The compound ID is defined as a concatenation of the WID of the extended business object, a semi-colon, and the reference ID of the custom object. Example: The Worker ID (ID=66faa65677834f0a9b586dd5645e900) links with the reference ID (grantName=Merit_4Q2011), separated by a semicolon (;) to look like: /customObjects/stockGrants/66faa65677834f0a9b586dd5645e9004;grantName=Merit_4Q2011.
Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

put.summary: Updates existing instances of custom objects. For multi-instance custom objects
put.description:
PUT updates existing instances of custom objects. For multi-instance custom objects, you can use either the custom object ID or the compound ID.  If the object doesn't exist, you receive an error message.
Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

parameters.name: putCustomObjectRequest
parameters.description: The details of the custom object that's being persisted

delete.summary: Delete an instance of a custom object.
delete.description:
The DELETE operation removes a single custom object. For multi-instance custom objects, you can use either the custom object ID or the compound ID.  If the object doesn't exist, you receive an error message.
Secured by: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object
Scope: Dependent on Security Domain configured for the Custom Object.

AnyValue.description: Since this represents a custom object, it can be any type
